= JBoss EAP 4.3 / 5.1 / 6.2 - Java EE supported standards in each EAP releases
Maxime Gr√©au
2013-12-10

:published_at: 2013-12-10

TIP: Language EN / Timereading 5 mn

[NOTE]
.This post presents, as a diagram, all Java EE standards supported in each JBoss EAP version : 
====
* This diagram was updated in December 2013 (fixes and addition of (*) information)
* Thanks to Arun Gupta for the fixes
* The following data are based on official documentation from Oracle (JSR) and Red Hat (EAP).
====

pass::[more]

You can *click on each component to access the Java Specification Requests (JSRs)* details or move to the complete lists.

++++
<div class="mxgraph" style="position:relative;overflow:hidden;width:1212px;height:935px;"><div style="width:1px;height:1px;overflow:hidden;"></div></div>
<script src="//drawdotio.appspot.com/embed.js" type="text/javascript"></script>
++++

== List of all Java EE JSRs supported 
=== Supported in JBoss EAP 4.3 / 5 /6

* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=052[JSR 052: A Standard Tag Library for JavaServer Pages]
* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=067[JSR 067: JavaTM APIs for XML Messaging 1.0]
* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=093[JSR 093: JavaTM API for XML Registries 1.0 (JAXR)]
* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=101[JSR 101: JavaTM APIs for XML based RPC]
* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=153[JSR 153: Enterprise JavaBeansTM 2.1]
* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=181[JSR 181: Web Services Metadata for the JavaTM Platform]
* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=220[JSR 220: Enterprise JavaBeansTM 3.0]
* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=914[JSR 914: JavaTM Message Service (JMS) API]
* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=919[JSR 919: JavaMail]

=== Supported in JBoss EAP 4.3

* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=151[JSR 151: JavaTM 2 Platform, Enterprise Edition 1.4 (J2EE 1.4) Specification]
* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=088[JSR 88: JavaTM EE Application Deployment]
* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=109[JSR 109: Implementing Enterprise Web Services]
* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=115[JSR 115: JavaTM Authorization Contract for Containers]
* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=154[JSR 154: JavaTM Servlet 2.4 Specification]
* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=224[JSR 224: JavaTM API for XML-Based Web Services (JAX-WS) 2.0]
* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=907[JSR 907: JavaTM Transaction API (JTA)]

=== Supported in JBoss EAP 4.3 / 5.1

* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=077[JSR 077: J2EETM Management]
* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=112[JSR 112: J2EETM Connector Architecture 1.5]
* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=220[JSR 220: Enterprise JavaBeansTM 3.0]
* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=222[JSR 222: JavaTM Architecture for XML Binding (JAXB) 2.0]
* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=245[JSR 245: JavaServerTM Pages 2.1]
* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=250[JSR 250: Common Annotations for the JavaTM Platform]
* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=252[JSR 252: JavaServer Faces 1.2]

=== Supported in JBoss EAP 5.1

* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=244[JSR 244: JavaTM Platform, Enterprise Edition 5 (Java EE 5) Specification]
* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=109[JSR 109: Implementing Enterprise Web Services]
* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=115[JSR 115: JavaTM Authorization Contract for Containers]
* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=154[JSR 154: JavaTM Servlet 2.4 Specification]
* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=224[JSR 224: JavaTM API for XML-Based Web Services (JAX-WS) 2.0]
* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=311[JSR 311: JAX-RS: The JavaTM API for RESTful Web Services]

=== Supported in JBoss EAP 5.1 / 6

* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=045[JSR 045: Debugging Support for Other Languages]
* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=088[JSR 088: JavaTM EE Application Deployment]
* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=907[JSR 907: JavaTM Transaction API (JTA)]

=== Supported in JBoss EAP 6

* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=316[JSR 316: JavaTM Platform, Enterprise Edition 6 (Java EE 6) Specification]
* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=077[JSR 077: J2EETM Management]
* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=109[JSR 109: Implementing Enterprise Web Services]
* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=115[JSR 115: JavaTM Authorization Contract for Containers]
* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=222[JSR 222: JavaTM Architecture for XML Binding (JAXB) 2.0]
* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=224[JSR 224: JavaTM API for XML-Based Web Services (JAX-WS) 2.0]
* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=245[JSR 245: JavaServerTM Pages 2.1]
* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=250[JSR 250: Common Annotations for the JavaTM Platform]
* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=299[JSR 299: Contexts and Dependency Injection for the JavaTM EE platform]
* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=303[JSR 303: Bean Validation]
* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=311[JSR 311: JAX-RS: The JavaTM API for RESTful Web Services]
* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=314[JSR 314: JavaServer Faces 2.0]
* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=315[JSR 315: JavaTM Servlet 3.0 Specification]
* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=317[JSR 317: JavaTM Persistence 2.0]
* http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=322[JSR 322: JavaTM EE Connector Architecture 1.6]
